snippet: The miners died in an accident inside a coal mine whose long history of safety violations had already brought it under special scrutiny by federal officials.
abstract: Two miners die in an accident inside a West Virginia coal mine whose long history of safety violations had already brought it under special scrutiny by federal officials; mine owner Patriot Coal Corporation says accident occurred as the miners were carving away at one of the many pillars of coal that kept the roof from collapsing.

byline.original: By DANIEL HEYMAN and MICHAEL WINES
byline.contributor: Daniel Heyman reported from Wharton, and Michael Wines from New York.

lead_paragraph: The miners died in an accident inside a coal mine whose long history of safety violations had already brought it under special scrutiny by federal officials.

headline.main: 2 Killed in West Virginia Mine Where Safety Lapses Were Cited
headline.print_headline: 2 Killed in West Virginia Mine Where Safety Lapses Were Cited
